name: Gergely Orosz
description: Gergely writes The Pragmatic Engineer, the #1 technology newsletter on Substack. Formerly a software engineer and engineering manager at Uber, he is also the author of The Software Engineer’s Guidebook and other books on building software at scale.

name: Agur Jõgi
description: Agur Jõgi is the CTO at Pipedrive, where he leads development, infrastructure, and the company's next-generation tech vision. Previously Strategy and Innovation Lead at Deloitte NEXT, he brings executive experience as CIO, CTO, and COO across IT, banking, and telecom.

name: Dominik Kundel
description: Dominik is currently working on Developer Experience & SDKs at OpenAI. Previously he lead Product & Design for Twilio's Emerging Tech & Innovation organization. Dominik loves tinkering with anything that can run JavaScript, from front-end servers to CLIs and coffee machines. You can find him tweeting @dkundel and in his spare time he's working on cocktails, food and photography.

name: Ivan Kutskir
description: Ivan Kutskir is the solo creator of Photopea, a free web-based alternative to Photoshop with over 1M users per day. He built the app entirely on his own — no team, office, or investors — and continues to develop it today from Prague.

name: Dima Maleev
description: Dima Maleev is an Associate Director of Engineering at Agoda with over 20 years of journey in tech. He runs So Nerdy!, a course and community for engineers stepping into leadership, and co-founder of mentor.sh, a platform connecting mentors with those who want to grow.

name: Łukasz Borowiecki
description: DCo-founder of 10 Senses, a consultancy focused on AI and advanced analytics. With a PhD in Economics and 15+ years in data science and consulting (including EY), he authors publications on AI adoption in Poland and contributes to the national AI Working Group.

name: Michał Nowotka
description: Michał is an engineering manager at Asana, leading product engineering teams focused on integrations and reporting. Previously, he led engineering teams at Snowflake, Bolt, and YouGov. Passionate about AI, open-source, and software design, Michał has been engaged with technology long before it became mainstream.

name: Anastasia Voitova
position: Head of security engineering @ Cossack Labs
description: Anastasiia is a cybersecurity engineer with 10+ years’ experience in data protection and cryptography. She speaks at international conferences, contributes to OWASP, and co-organises cybersecurity events.

name: Artem Yavorsky
description: Artem is a full-stack engineer at Writer, building agentic AI systems and creator of unbuilt.app, an open-source tool for tech stack analysis. He is also a creator of unbuilt.app, ex Netflix, ex Wix. He enjoys cycling, cooking, and time with his dog, Lavender.

name: Sanya Solovyov
description: Sanya is a seasoned industry professional, most recently being CTO at Kasta.ua and then EM at Metabase. He had some successful talks in the past, so (fingers crossed) the story will continue.

name: Mykola Maksymenko
description: Mykola, Co-founder and CTO of Haiqu, is a visionary technologist advancing the frontier of quantum computing and AI. He focuses on transforming deep-tech breakthroughs into impactful innovations that shape the future of industry and society.

name: Andrii Degeler
description: Andrii Degeler is a tech media leader and podcast host with 15+ years covering Europe’s startup and deep-tech ecosystem. He’s worked with outlets like TNW, Tech.eu, Ars Technica, and Engadget, spotlighting key innovation trends across the continent.
